YouTube has started quietly disabling notifications for users who haven't recently interacted with them, even if they’re set to “All,” for a specific channel. The goal is to reduce notification fatigue, but creators could get caught in the crossfire. Where’s the line between platform optimization and messing with user choice?

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nRyI3y4o9eM

Nintendo just made sharing digital Switch games way easier by allowing Family Group members to lend virtual game cards across devices, even offline for up to 14 days. It's a shockingly consumer-friendly move that could also pressure Microsoft and Sony to step up. Is Nintendo finally embracing the digital future… or just trying to outmaneuver piracy?
